result.execSummary:
The defendant Brieanna M. Persike was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: J.G.-to be paid at the rate of no less than $70.00 per month. To begin June 2015.
FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or at anytime defendant does not meet that condition, then she must perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with victims S/Y/, J.G., & A.W.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
Defendant entitled to 18 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:08am
INCLUDES 15CM166, 16CM1343, 16CM1471, 17CM1104, 17CF1148, 17CM1942
State appears by ADA Davis Runde in 16CM1343 & 16CM1471 and for ADA Minder in 15CM166, for ADA Lawrence in 17CF1148 & 17CM1942, and for ADA Uttke in 17CM1104; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Pauline Toulouse
Date and time set for SAR in 15CM166l, 16CM1343, 16CM1471, 17CM1104 & plea hearing in 17CF1148 & 17CM1942

** SAR in 15CM166, 16CM1343, 16CM1471, 17CM1104 **
Parties state recommendation for sentencing.
COURT ORDERS: 15CM166 Ct. 1- Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, PTAC: Serve 9 months MCJ. Any outstanding costs are to be paid as condition of ES. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM1343 Ct. 1- Resisting or Obstructing an Officer- repeater: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. Any outstanding costs are tbe paid as condition of ES. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM1471 Ct. 1- Theft-Movable Property <=$2500- repeater:  2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. Ct. 3 Bail Jumping-Midemeanor- repeater:  2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. Any outstanding costs are to be paid as condition of ES. 
COURT ORDERS: 17CM1104 Ct. 1 Retail Theft- Intentionally take (<=$500)- repeater: 2 years WSPS: 1 year IC, 1 year ES. Ct. 2  Retail Theft- Intentionally take (<=$500)- repeater: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. Any outstanding costs to be paid as condition of ES. 

** PLEA in 17CF1148 & 17CM1942 **
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
17CF1148: AMEND Ct. 1 Escape-Criminal Arrest to TWO counts of Misdemeanor Failure to Report to Jail- repeater 946.425(1m)
COURT grants above
PLEA:
17CF1148:
AMENDED Ct. 1 Failure to report to jail- repeater >> NO CONTEST
AMENDED Ct. 2 Failure to report to jail- repeater >> NO CONTEST
17CM1942:
Ct. 1 Retail Theft- Intentionally take (<=$500)- repeater >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 Criminal Damage to Property- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 17CF1148 Ct. 1 & Ct. 2: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. CONDITIONS of ES: Pay all outstanding fees and court costs. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
COURT ORDERS: 17CM1942 Ct. 1 & Ct. 2: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. CONDITIONS of ES: Pay all outstanding fees and court costs. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

ALL SENTENCES ARE TO BE SERVED CONCURRENTLY TO EACH OTHER. 
Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse Programming & Challenge Incarceration Programming. 
Parties will confer on jail credit issue and provide stipulation to court.
Adj: 10:36am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 28, 2017 at 09:50 am.

15CF13, 15CF82, 15CM166, and 15CM289

State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in custody and with Atty James Kurszewski. Date and time set for Waiver of Preliminary.  Atty Kurszewski states to Court he is ready to go forward with plea, however, State needs to notify victims.  Court will reset plea hearing on Mon. 6/1/15 in the afternoon.  Parties to meet with JA after Court to set date.  Waiver of Prelimary filed on 15CF13 and 15CF82.  Court ques. Deft re: Waiver.   Court finds Waiver freely & vol. made, finds probable cause & binds Deft over for Trial.  Information filed.  Atty Kurszewski enters plea of not guility to each count, and waives reading.  Bond continues.

appeared

INCLUDES 15CF13, 15CF82, 15CM166, 15CM289.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Department if this has not already been done.  No contact with victim(s): W.W.; A.W.; A.W.; J.G.; S.Y.; J.G.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve personal belongings.
